properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Robinvale.
  • There is a bushfire on Knights Island, Robinvale that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 09/09/2025 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Knights Island, Robinvale
Issue Date: Monday 08 September 2025, 04:59 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 09 September 2025, 05:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38144/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Robinvale.
- There is a bushfire on Knights Island, Robinvale that is not yet under control.
- Firefighters are responding to this fire.


There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Porepunkah. 
  • Victoria Police are searching for an armed and dangerous offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) in the area of Porepunkah.
  • Travel in the area should be restricted to essential activities only.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 4:50pm Saturday, 6 September.
If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call 000 immediately and do not approach the offender. 
What you should do:
  • If you are in the Porepunkah area, you must follow instructions of emergency services at the scene.
  • Anyone with information is asked to call 000 immediately, or contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 333 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
If you are outside the warning area:
  • Avoid the broader Porepunkah area.
  • Follow roadblocks and traffic diversions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
This message is being issued by Victoria Police. 

The next update is expected by 09/09/2025 06:00 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • if you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice is being issued for Murchison, Murchison East. 
  • Goulburn Valley Water has advised that as of 7:30pm Friday 5 September, the tap water at Murchison and Murchison East is not safe to drink without boiling first.
  • This is an updated Advice message that replaces the Advice issued at 10:12AM Sunday 7 September.
  • Recent monitoring of the Murchison water supply system detected an abnormality in the water treatment process.
  • Goulburn Valley Water is undertaking follow up testing to check that the water supply is fit for human consumption.
  • All residents must boil their drinking water until further notice. 
If you live or work within Murchison and Murchison East, you must boil tap water before drinking.
What you should do:  
  • Boil water before drinking it, or drink bottled water.
  • Boil water for food preparation, cleaning fruit and vegetables, making ice and for preparing baby formula.
  • Boil water for brushing teeth. 
To ensure water is safe, you should: 
  • Heat water until a continuous and rapid stream of air-bubbles is produced from the bottom of a pan or kettle (kettles with automatic shut-off switches are suitable). 
  • Allow water to cool before use. 
  • Store water in a clean, closed container for later use. 
  • Be careful when boiling water to prevent scalding or burns.
  • If you are concerned that you may have been affected by contaminated water, contact your doctor or Nurse-on-Call. 
Unboiled water can be used for: 
  • Showering and bathing (avoid swallowing water) 
  • Flushing toilets
  • Washing dishes and clothes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Drinking water is expected to be affected for the next couple of days.
  • The Boil Water Notice will remain in place until Goulburn Valley Water is confident that there is no longer a risk to public health.
  • Goulburn Valley Water is undertaking water quality sampling to establish the quality of water being supplied to customers.
For more information or assistance, residents can: 
  • Visit www.gvwater.vic.gov.au/incidents 
  • Call Goulburn Valley Waterâ€™s 24-hour Customer Service Centre on 1800 454 500.
This message was issued by Department of Health.

The next update is expected by 09/09/2025 01:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - DRINKING WATER - Boil Tap Water
Incident Location: Murchison and Murchison East
Issue Date: Monday 08 September 2025, 12:51 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 09 September 2025, 01:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38141/moreinfo

This Advice is being issued for Murchison, Murchison East. 
- Goulburn Valley Water has advised that as of 7:30pm Friday 5 September, the tap water at Murchison and Murchison East is not safe to drink without boiling first.
- This is an updated Advice message that replaces the Advice issued at 10:12AM Sunday 7 September.
- Recent monitoring of the Murchison water supply system detected an abnormality in the water treatment process.
- Goulburn Valley Water is undertaking follow up testing to check that the water supply is fit for human consumption.
-   All residents must boil their drinking water until further notice. 


If you live or work within Murchison and Murchison East, you must boil tap water before drinking.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Areas surrounding Porepunkah including Wangaratta and Mount Beauty
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah.
  • Victoria Police advise that the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues in the broader Porepunkah area.
  • It is recommended that people travelling to Bright, Falls Creek or Mount Hotham avoid travelling through Porepunkah and instead, travel via Happy Valley Road at C534 and the Kiewa Valley Highway.
  • This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 5:09pm Thursday, 4 September. 
If you see Desmond, call 000 immediately and do not approach him.
What you should do:
  • Anyone who has any information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
Impacts in your area:
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
  • Multiple police units remain in the general area of Porepunkah.
This message was issued by Victoria Police.

The next update is expected by 09/09/2025 06:00 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment, contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

- Victoria Police advise that the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues in the broader Porepunkah area.   
- It is recommended that people travelling to Bright, Falls Creek or Mount Hotham avoid travelling through Porepunkah and instead, travel via Happy Valley Road at C534 and the Kiewa Valley Highway.
- This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 5:09pm Thursday, 4 September. 


If you see Desmond, call 000 immediately and do not approach him.
